name: Good Health (IAPSOP)
content:
Good Health (IAPSOP) About Archives Practices Contribute Contacts Search     Periodical: Good Health Summary:  From Pat Deveney's database: Good Health. The Oldest Health Magazine in the World -- Established 1866 1866--1914? Monthly Battle Creek, MI. Editor: John Harvey Kellogg. 1/1, 1866. 48 pp. The journal was intended as reading material for patients at Kellogg's sanatarium in Battle Creek and as a lure to attract those interested in "good health" to visit the sanatarium and to buy Kellogg's books and health products. On Kellogg, see also the note under Battle Creek Idea. The journal was filled with diatribes against tobacco, alcohol ("Czar's Edict Establishes Prohibition in Russia--Only Good Result of War"), cane syrup, meat, polished rice, promiscuity (and sex generally), and encomiums for natural cornmeal, proper clothing, air baths, cereal coffee, etc. Issues:Good Health V25 N9 Sep 1890 Good Health V25 N11 Nov 1890 Good Health V26 N1 Jan 1891 Good Health V27 N7 Jul 1892 Good Health V30 N8 Aug 1895 Good Health V32 N12 Dec 1903 Good Health V35 N7 Midsummer 1900 Good Health V39 N1 Jan 1904 Good Health V39 N5 May 1904 Good Health V42 N7 Jul 1907 Good Health V42 N11 Nov 1907 Good Health V49 N1 Dec 1914 Good Health V49 N1 Jan 1914 Good Health V49 N2 Feb 1914 Good Health V49 N3 Mar 1914 Good Health V49 N4 Apr 1914 Good Health V49 N5 May 1914 Good Health V49 N6 Jun 1914 Good Health V49 N7 Jul 1914 Good Health V49 N8 Aug 1914 Good Health V49 N9 Sep 1914 Good Health V49 N10 Oct 1914 Good Health V49 N11 Nov 1914
